results.title: Estuaries
results.creator_credit: Dietmar Fill, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Micro-photographic study of marine life in estuaries. Shows a great variety of marine animals and plants that thrive in the unique environment of the estuaries, one of the most productive natural systems in the world. Details the lifestyles of the sea horse, semaphore crabs, soldier crabs, prawns, oysters and mangroves.

results.title: Ethiopian mosaic
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An engrossing blend of scenes in the ancient kingdom of Ethiopia where indolent camels still sway through the sand and long-robed tribesmen race their Arabian steeds, while great airliners glide into a modern airport. Produced without commentary, this film seems to put the viewer in the midst of the crowds of smiling people, among whom is glimpsed the emperor himself, Haile Selassie, Lion of Judah.

results.title: Eternity and a day = Mia Eoniotita ke mia mira
results.creator_credit: Theo Angelopoulos, Phoebe Economopoulos, La Sept Cinema, Intermedias, Paradis Films, Greek Television and Greek Film Centre
results.brief_description: Bruno Ganz plays Alexander, a famous author reaching the end of his life. On the eve of going into hospital he encounters a young Albanian refugee boy who is one of the thousands of illegal immigrants from Eastern Europe coming into Greece. Alexander begins a quest to return the boy home, and when that proves impossible, attempts to give the young orphan the security and opportunities unavailable on the streets. All the while his thoughts take him back into the past, where he attempts to make amends for his, at times, indifferent treatment of his wife, his child, and his mother. The voyage of the poet and the young boy culminates in a magical bus ride through Balkan history where Alexander comes to understand both the futility of one individual’s acts in affecting history, as well as finally understanding the true worth of a poet’s words. Angelopoulos’ languid and mesmerising mise-en-scene, combined with his passion for a cinema of intellectual commitment, has made him one of Europe’s premier contemporary artists of the transcendant. Features a beautiful score by Eleni Karaindrou. “Eternity and a Day” won the Palme d’Or at the 1998 Cannes Film Festival.

group_works.title: Climate in crisis
group_works.creator_credit: Jeff Gale, Judith John-Story, David Mason, Jeremy Evans, BBC-TV and For Beyond Productions

results.title: Climate in crisis
results.creator_credit: Jeff Gale, Judith John-Story, David Mason, Jeremy Evans, BBC-TV and For Beyond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Beyond 2000”.
A “Beyond 2000”, joint B.B.C. production which gives an overview of the problems associated with the Greenhouse Effect. A series of small episodes which clearly explains what the Greenhouse Effect is and its impact on the earth both now and in the future. The programs also discuss stategies and plans that may help turn around the environmental exploitation of our finite resources.

results.title: Super Flight
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Beyond 2000”.
A Beyond 2000 special which looks at the latest advances in aeronautics, from ultra-lights to gyrocopters, from fighters to paraplanes, in fact every way in which man can currently take to the air.

results.title: Eternal Youth
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Beyond 2000”.
Everybody wants it, and many have searched for it. “Beyond 2000” explores the growth of the life prolonging industry and the study of gerontology. It’s a penetrating look at a topic dear to each and everyone of us - life!

results.title: Essentials of tap technique
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In this delightful performance collaboration, Blumberg highlights the tap skills of dancers Charles ‘Cookie’ Cook, Brenda Bufalino and Kevin Ramsey. Focusing on the performers’ movements from the knee down, Blumberg uses slow motion to isolate such tap techniques as the ‘toe stab,’ ‘flam with pull-back,’ and ‘trenches.’ The syncopated tapping forms a rhythmic counterpart to the dancers’ demonstration of the essentials of their art.

results.title: Essay writing made easy
results.creator_credit: Peter Lane, Ruth Lee, Dennis Famigia and Deakin University
results.brief_description: James Valentine takes the viewer through the six stages of essay writing: analysing the question; researching; planning; writing; and editing & presentation. Each stage is clearly presented with practical advice from both academics and students. Study guide included.
